website_summaries.verdict: With its excellent waterproofing, the Talus Trek Low UltraDry does live up to its name. Outside water protection, the shoe also seems to have hit the home run thanks to its incredible amounts of comfort and remarkable surface grip. What some might find detestable in this Vasque gear, however, is its hit-or-miss heel hold. All in all, the Talus Trek Low UltraDry is a highly competent shoe that shines in many areas. Those who are prone to heel lift might want to steer clear of it though.
pros: The Vasque Talus Trek Low UltraDry stumped critics with its ability to fence out watery elements
A great multitude was astounded by the shoe’s entrancing level of comfort
Its extraordinary surface traction left many owners in amazement
This Vasque hiking gear was praised by several users for its outstanding arch support
Bloggers were impressed with the Talus Trek Low UltraDry’s fantastic durability
One of them was especially floored by the longevity of the shoe’s outsole
Less than a handful of wearers commended the footwear’s superb lightness
cons: Expert reviewers experienced heel lift in the Talus Trek Low UltraDry, and they weren’t thrilled at all about it
A professional gear tester didn’t like the water-absorbent leather upper of the gear
She said that, although water didn't leak into the shoe, it did soak up its upper and weighed her down as a result

customer_reviews.title: Good, but image color off.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace Vasque Breeze 2.0 which served me well. Tops still perfect, soles worn. Haven't worn these yet but wanted to leave info that color shown for Black Olive/Aluminum is off. Picture is too gray. More brown actual. see attached pics.
customer_reviews.author: E. Yeh

customer_reviews.title: Vasque continues to make a quality product
customer_reviews.text: Since I suffer from arthritis in my ankles I would like a shoe to be stiffer and a high top for hiking, but the Vasque Talus Trek Low Ultradry Hiking Shoe is excellent for walking. I also own the higher cut version of this shoe and it is excellent for hiking without a backpack. The fit is the same as my other 3 pair of Vasque shoes and all except the Summit model did not require any break in period. I have become a huge Vasque fan and purchasing this pair has only verified that my loyalty to the brand is justified. I highly recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: JFT

customer_reviews.title: Vasque are good quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: Vasque are good quality shoes. I've wanted a pair for a while seeing them in stores, but not able to find a wide size. Finally I found this one in a size that I thought would fit. It does. I'm a 9.5W and this fits as expected. The quality is nice, they're very sturdy and well built. The sole is a little hard and flat compared to other brands, It's not "cushy" or ultra contoured. But they don't hurt my feet and that's what counts. The "green" color is barely green at all thankfully, it's almost khaki. There is a touch of green in there but they're pretty neutral, not too "green".
customer_reviews.author: Jim W

customer_reviews.title: Shoes fine but run a little small; shoelaces not to good
customer_reviews.text: The shoes themselves seem fine, although they do appear to run a bit small. I ordered a half size larger, per the advice of some other reviewers, and they fit correctly. My only complaint concerns the shoestrings. Most hiking shoes come with the cylindrical shaped shoelaces which tend to stay tied fairly well. These come with the ribbon shoelaces and it seems that I'm always having to stop and retie my shoes. I'm going to replace the laces with a cylindrical pair.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes....they do run small, both length and width.
customer_reviews.text: Vasque makes high quality shoes and boots even if they are made in China. The leather appears to be very high grade and the workmanship looks impeccable. They definitely run small. I normally wear a 10 medium and exchanged those for 10.5 2ee (wide). Much better fit though not perfect. The left shoe still feels slightly short and the right heel feels slightly wide but they'll do. If not for this they would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: RonPaulAholic

customer_reviews.title: Good low hiking  shoes, water resistant
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of the Talus Trek Low hiking shoes. The first pair wore out after ~2 years of regular use on trails and sidewalks. I have found them to have good traction on most surfaces, even wet rocks. They aren't the lightest weight, but they give good support. I have relatively narrow feet, somewhere between B and D, and these shoes fit comfortably, something many other D sized mediums don't do.
customer_reviews.author: K. Heinemann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes. The waterproofing has been perfect
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes. The waterproofing has been perfect, they have great support for hiking yet are light and comfortable for all day wear. I often have them on for 14 hours and I average 16,000-17,000 steps per day on my Fitbit. I need a shoe with a generous toe box and these are perfect. I have the grey/green color which is very nice and as soon as they come out with another color I like I’ll buy another pair. These are as good as my Solomon’s for $70 less!
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: Front of sole comes loose
customer_reviews.text: I do extensive off-trail hiking and this shoe is solid enough for traversing and descending steep loose slopes. It and the Vasque Breeze III GTX have been my shoes of choice for the last few years., fitting me very well. But I've owned 3 pairs of these and all 3 have had the sole come loose where it wraps up at the front of the shoe. I've had varying success at gluing it back together. I beat up any footwear very quickly, but this defect definitely shortens their usable lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: David  Carmody

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes. We’ve purchased eight pair of them now. He’s a roofer in Florida so his shoes go through some serious heat & beating. He used to go through shoes once every month or two and was spending a ridiculous amount of money on shoes all the time just for them to tear apart. We decided to splurge a little and found these at a local shoe store and he loved them from the very first day. He now keeps a pair for home use and a pair for work use. We’ve been buying them for going on four years now and they hold up SO well to his abuse. Must have if you’re an outdoor worker.
customer_reviews.author: LeeAnna

customer_reviews.title: This shoe runs one whole size too small!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to go up an entire shoe size, just to be able to walk in this brand of hiking shoe. I'm not sure why this is the case, but the other reviews stating that this brand runs small are totally accurate! Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vasque: Another good walking shoe...
customer_reviews.text: Vasque has another nice waterproof heavy duty walking shoe. This reviewer found the fit to be a little bit snugger than usual for Vasque shoes. The problem seemed to work itself out with thinner socks. Be prepared to experiment with the lacing to get it right. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: HMS Warspite

customer_reviews.title: A New Favorite Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn them nearly every day for two months. I believe I've found my new favorite shoe! Good weight, size seems to run a half size small, and I'm glad another reviewer thinks the laces are a bit too long. But I'd rather double knot than too short. This is my second Vasque pair. I'm pretty rough on the soles, but if I need to I'll consider resoling when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: JMAlexandria

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Men’s Size 9 feels like size 8. Have been wearing Vasque shoes for many years and never had this issue. Even looked at tag to be sure they were size ordered.. just very tight and uncomfortable for the size that should fit!
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: A great hiking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking and a quality made shoe. Vasque never disappoints. The toe box is a little large, but comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: vcooper

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but on the tight side
customer_reviews.text: Make sure that you know your size. I find the wide size of this shoe tight for my feet. Excellent shoes otherwise. I did not want to return because I used them for a week before I discovered that they are not going to stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Ghareeb

customer_reviews.title: They are a snug fit which is how I like them so they are true to size
customer_reviews.text: Wore them around the house first day to check fit. Went for a little hike to break them in and it turned into 4 hours. No significant issues. They are a snug fit which is how I like them so they are true to size. Had little rubbing on outside of foot by end of trip but ok considering length of walk on boots that weren't broken in properly. Looking forward to years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, feel great
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that I do not like about these outstanding shoes, is the price on Amazon. You can find them considerably less expensive somewhere else. I feel a little bit shortchanged here.
customer_reviews.author: Alex-Biker

customer_reviews.title: Lousy shoe laces!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, except for way to long cheap, inexpensive shoe laces! Needed a nice bungee cord system or a nice round nylon dhie lace the correct length. You would think simple?
customer_reviews.author: Quick Vic

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought for family member. He said shoes are very comfortable, and he likes them very much.
customer_reviews.author: Resse

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch shoe!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keen shoes for about 17 years because they were the only ones that I can find that lasted in my line of work I work at a golf course in my feet are constantly getting wet I'm here to say if you shoes at bump Keen off the list I'll be going with these shoes for now on
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these shoes now, for almsot a year. I have treked up Fuji, and Alaska, and these shoes show almost no wear. They are my daily wear shoes and they are still running strong. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sly S.

customer_reviews.title: All day comfort
customer_reviews.text: I am on my feet all day and these were an excellent choice. Amazon was sooo much cheaper then the outdoor store I tried these on at. I like Lowa but they are just so expensive, I switched to these Vasque, and they get a 95 out of 100 which would be the Lowa for comfort and arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Zombie Prepper

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Dry
customer_reviews.text: Have only worn 3-4 days, but I’m happy with the hiking shoes so far. I’ve had very wet dew each morning and my feet have stayed dry. The shoes are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great quality not great comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great quality; BUT not waterproof - very disappointed as this was why I bought the shoes - as advertised seem very durable but....not the most comfortable hikers I’v ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very nice. they wear well and good for daily hiking and hunting.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Casual shoe for the office and great for the outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for casual Friday at work and great for outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes for what I'm using them for
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes for what I'm using them for. I work in healthcare and am on my feet all day and these provide the support I need. Of course, I also use Superfeet insoles to help. I recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Rindosh

customer_reviews.title: OAF
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best shoes $ can buy, just got my second pair. Especially good when you are on rough terrain or in a industrial environment. Very nice in wet and snowy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dennis

customer_reviews.title: FAVORITE SHOE FOR ALMOST ALL MY EVERYDAY FUNCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the shoe. It’s my second pair. However,I goofed and mistakenly ordered 10M instead of 10.5M and I wore them twice before checking. MY BAD. I won’t make the same mistake twice but will definitely order THIS shoe again in the RIGHT size next time. John Dickinson
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CLUNKY
customer_reviews.text: I love Vasquez boots, but these fit a little weird. Very clunky, with no ankle support. No, I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, just as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Took a few days to break in but now they are super comfy, and completely waterproof. Great shoes for the price and I have a feeling they will hold up for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. I wear it every day for work, and they wear well. This is my 5th pair in as many years.
customer_reviews.author: SD Qualls

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe! Size as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this pair of hiking shoes. Especially happy that sizes of Vasque shoes remain constant, allowing you to order shoes without worrying that the size you order will vary from previous orders.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Smith

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair I've owned. Really good shoes.worth the money.I work on my feet all day. Supports great.
customer_reviews.author: John Hilliard

customer_reviews.title: Quality materials in a tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking shoe with a comfortable yet solid feel. Order a half size larger than normal as the shoe runs small and narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Luther

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe, material kinda scratches easily but very comfortable. Much better than my last pair of merrel's. I did have a problem with whatever vendor that shipped to me however I received shoes that somebody had already worn and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of the box! Went for a 5 mile hike and had no issues. Being waterproof is a very nice feature when hiking through wet grass. Highly recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: figbe

customer_reviews.title: ... second pair in three years and I am as satisfied today as I was with the first pair
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair in three years and I am as satisfied today as I was with the first pair. Vasque is clearly committed to design and produce high-quality shoes. If you are a serious hiker as I am I recommend your these fine pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Arrocha

customer_reviews.title: 13D
customer_reviews.text: Graet shoe I can now wear comfortably all day however these shoes were a little narrow when I first purchased them but broke in easy.
customer_reviews.author: Glockman

customer_reviews.title: Favorite work shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for work. I do add super feet insoles
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Quality build. I use a couple times a week. Comfortable and light weight. Haven't been hiking, just walking around.
customer_reviews.author: WW44

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: I think they were wrong to put the size. I bought 12 M, but it's 11.
customer_reviews.author: REM

customer_reviews.title: very good shoe
customer_reviews.text: felt slightly smaller than expected, odd fit until they were broken in, but I wear them everywhere including rocky trails and light bouldering.
customer_reviews.author: UtilityEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a shoe with versatility. It fits exactly as expected (using the same size was my running shoes and hiking boots), and the shoes are very comfortable. I also think they look nice enough to wear for casual outings in town.
customer_reviews.author: D. White

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Hiking Shoe Yet
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these for the past 3 times. They are great for hiking in the mountains and they keep your feet dry. While keeping your feet functional they also look good out on the town. I would always recommend these to anyone and Vasque is an awesome brand all around.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Berryman

customer_reviews.title: Quality & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality & very comfortable. Perfect fit not narrow and plenty room for my toes
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: The heel area.
customer_reviews.text: The heel area wears quickly. I would think they would have lasted longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best of the rest
customer_reviews.text: These are the fourth brand I tried and they fit the bill perfectly. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: robert e.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Way to small and not comfortable. I thought I could do a regular 11, I needed a 11 wide
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: Half size larger perfect
customer_reviews.text: Based upon previous reviews, I purchased a half size larger. Fits great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very stiff. Tried breaking them in but they are still very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Pugs

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable enough for everyday wear, sturdy enough for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of these. First ones lasted about 2 1/2 years of everyday wear, plus several hiking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Ricnard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great shoes for outdoor life... stomp on whatever, and never even notice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ultra Dry - NOT
customer_reviews.text: Bought in late March of this year, only worn for disc golf - feet soaked this morning from dew. Ultra-dry NOT
customer_reviews.author: Dale Riley

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They are a tad more on the green olive side of olive than I was expecting but the traction and comfort are spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Finn

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: They were too small, so I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: But it runs small. I needed one size larger that the rest of my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Don Chouinard

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality but Runs VERY Narrow
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough rating since the quality of this shoes seems to be superior; however, I am surprised by the sizing. I usually wear a size 11 regular width shoe. I read some reviews that these shoes can be a little narrow, so I ordered a size 11 Wide and could not believe how snug they fit. They are so snug that I will be returning them. I am disappointed as I really like the style and quality of this shoe. My wife has a pair and loves them. She does not have an issue with the width.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Ron

customer_reviews.title: ... size I had with prior pair that I really liked but were 7-8 years old
customer_reviews.text: Originally ordered in size 12 since that is size I had with prior pair that I really liked but were 7-8 years old. Too large so returned them for size 11.5 (my normal shoe size) but in wide after reading reviews with many comments about sizing being too narrow. Despite not ever wearing a wide shoe in the past the wide 11.5 fits perfect. Extremely comfortable on long hikes. Great shoes. Just what I was looking for. I would imagine that people with truly wide feet would have problems. Unless you have a super narrow foot my rec would be to order in the wide.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: I have flat feet. This is my 2nd pair ...
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet. This is my 2nd pair. I had my last pair 4 years. I still have them.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Vasque shoes run a bit tight
customer_reviews.text: We took the shoes to local cobbler and had him slightly stretch. But we have purchased Vasque shoes for over ten years. I feel the quality of the shoes has gone down and the sizing is a bit tight. Not real thrilled with this purchase. Are they still made in Canada? I think the box said Vietnam....that may be the issue.
customer_reviews.author: dmkolling

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the shoes because they were too big for my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Great light hikers
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Fits well. I'm walking all over New Zealand in them!
customer_reviews.author: Sders

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but not wide enough in the toe box
customer_reviews.text: Seemed really well constructed, but ultimately, not enough room in the toe box, so I had to return them. Instead I went with Merrell All Out Blaze hiking shoe that instantly fit well, with plenty of room. If you have a narrow foot, I think it is probably a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes.
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit sloppy in the heal but otherwise okay.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Himmelmann

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and drab.
customer_reviews.text: I normally love Vasque hiking shoes, but these are too heavy and their color accentuates the "drab" in "olive drab". Back they go!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Vasque Talus Trek Low shoe seems very comfortable and good hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Vasque Talus Trek Low shoe seems very comfortable and good hiking shoe. But what I got has esthetic problem, the left and right shoe are not equiform unfortunately. The nedlework on the upper leather has ca 3-4 mm difference, slipping between the left and the right shoe. So the boot lace holes are not in face of each other. The right and the left shoe are not reflexion each other. The size of the parts of the upper leather are not same on the left and on the right shoe. Very poor esthetic quality from Vietnam. Other problem: the shoe does not hold my angle, the shoe just like slippers, my foot moves in it. The size is right anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Vasque Men's Talus Trek Low UltraDry M Black Olive/Aluminium 38.5 EU
product_meta.description: Hit the trails with the modern comfort and support of the Vasque® Talus Trek Low UltraDry™ hiking boot! Ideal for day hiking with a lightweight pack. Upper made of 1.8mm waterproof nubuck leather and abrasion-resistant mesh. Ultradry™ components combine to create a waterproof lining that provides long-lasting dryness. Padded collar and tongue offer additional comfort. Lace-up closure with metal speed lacers offers a secure and snug fit. Heel pull provides a comfortable and easy entry. Molded EVA midsole and TPU Shank for cushioning and stability. Cushioned dual-density footbed delivers all-day comfort and support. Vibram® Nuasi outsole with XSTrek Compound provides amazing traction on various terrains. Perpetuum last offers a steady structure for long distance endeavors. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 1 lb 3 oz Product measurements were taken using size 8, width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: Dual density ethylene vinyl acetate foot bed
